general.headline: Recruitment and Consulting Executive at Business Umbrella-Recruitment ,training & consulting
general.mutualConnectionsText: You and Lynn both know Mohamad Al Hajj Sleiman, Karim Abdel baki, and 3 others
general.description:
I am currently a first-year sociology and anthropology major at American University of Beirut.

Throughout my education, I contribute to positive results through effective organization, prioritization, and follow-through of projects. I exercise a methodical approach to problem-solving. While I am independently motivated, I am collaborative with peers and search for ways to integrate valuable insights. Further, my critical thinking, attention to detail, and decision-making abilities will serve to support continued organizational efforts.

Identifying improved approaches and enhanced solutions to challenges are activities that drive and inspire me. Exploration, pursuit, and motivation are my frameworks for success. I believe that fresh perspectives and trying new techniques help the community evolve and grow. 

My goal is to be on the cutting-edge of social advancements. I aim to foster a reputation as a key contributor through innovation and critical thinking skills. Through these qualities, I have confidence in my ability to facilitate positive change and collective effort.

general.headline: Business Executive | Management Consulting | Strategy | Business Development | Project Management
general.mutualConnectionsText: You and Sami both know Rana Itani, Ziad Shaaban, and 13 others
general.description:
I AM proven leader delivering strategic analysis & operations methodologies, along with business development expertise, and a collaborative leadership style to organizations seeking a high-impact, self-motivated professional to build winning partnerships and relationships that produce exceptional results in areas focused on business growth.
 
I PROVIDE progressive, professional growth in general management and operations, delivering market expansion and revenue maximizing solutions largely within the academic industry. I have solid experience forging collaborative relationships with all relevant stakeholders.
 
 
WHAT I BRING:
o Distinguished career of progressive, professional growth using project management methodologies and strategic planning to facilitate planning and directing of strategic and long-range goals
o Documented success in developing and maintaining relationships between internal departments and external stakeholders as well as developing internal leaders
o Clearly communicate performance improvement ideas backed up by solid metrics so that all engaged parties are capable of understanding and implementing a plan of action

MY CORE COMPETENCIES
Financial Analysis | Performance Management | Business Development | Project Management | Strategic Planning | Ideation/Transformation | Budget Administration | Business Intelligence | Stakeholder Management | Staff Development | Regulatory Compliance | Change Management | Financial Reporting | Risk Management | Quality Assurance

OPEN FOR NEW OPPORTUNITIES

jobs.description:
Higher Ed Partners is an international online program manager with a track record of success in Latin America, United States, South Africa, and the United Kingdom.  Our mission is to increase access to top quality, affordable higher education for all citizens through online education. We work with university partners to offer high demand, quality programs fully online to qualified and underserved students, and we bring a unique suite of services to our partner universities without upfront investment on their part.

Provide business development and consulting services on behalf of the company in Lebanon, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait, United Arab Emirates, Egypt, and Jordan for the delivery of Online Program Management to universities. This is a fixed term part-time remote consultancy engagement.

SPECIFIC ACCOMPLISHMENTS INCLUDE:
o UNIVERSITY ENGAGEMENT: Reach out to prospective universities and lead the sale process.
o MARKET UNDERSTANDING: Research the specific market in each country for readiness for offering online
education.

Here is a web-based presentation about HEP.  https://heppartnerships.com/
  
      
          …
        
          see more

As a seasoned business executive with extensive experience in general management, strategy development and execution, business development, project management, ideation/transformation, I provide a wide range of recruitment and short-term consulting services to higher education and healthcare institutions in the MENA region in my areas of expertise either as an independent consultant, a team member or a team leader.

SPECIFIC ACCOMPLISHMENTS INCLUDE:
o RECRUITMENT SERVICES: Successful in identifying the appropriate candidate, pitching the opportunity, and placing senior executives for full/part-time engagement with clients.
o STRATEGY & IDEATION: Provide strategic insight and ideation on key trends in higher education and challenging client leadership on disruption in their current business model and assist them in adapting current business processes to become future ready institutions.
  
      
          …
        
          see more

receivedRecommandations.text: ‘Highly professional, honest and pragmatic’ is the phrase that comes to mind when I think about Sami. I had the pleasure of working with Sami for more than 15 years at the American University of Beirut. During that period we collaborated in various capacities on several projects, committees and initiatives. Above all, I was particularly impressed by Sami’s pragmatic approach and ability to handle even the toughest tasks with enthusiasm and effortlessly. Sami has a special way to engage people and get them on board. He is a team player, inquisitive, organized and deliverables oriented. Sami is also an experienced negotiator and a deal maker, all seems to come perfectly naturally to him. Sami is a people person and while dealing with Sami one cannot but befriend him, cherish his company and laugh to his jokes, notwithstanding that he is a terrible joke teller.  I am lucky and proud to have him as a friend and believe that he is a true asset to AUB and a humble team player and leader in the service of the community.

Sami's balanced approach to any topic is very positive
      and enables him to present different sides of any
      
      situation fairly objectively.

general.headline: Civil Engineering Graduate
general.mutualConnectionsText: You and Abedalrahman both know Charbel Hokayem, Jessy Assy, and 16 others
general.description:
Business acumen – I’m a Civil Engineering Graduate who is strongly interested in different aspects of Business. Having keenness and quickness in understanding and dealing with a business situation, combined with my engineering background, I decided to pursue a career that encounters both. 

Being the highly competitive person I am today, I have been able to develop an exponential relationship between my goals and achievements. The more I achieve, the thirstier I get. Accordingly, the more goals I set, the higher the standards of perfection I seek.

Throughout my years at university, I’ve seized the opportunity to participate in several competitions to enhance my analytical skills. I also joined different clubs to put my leadership and communication skills into practice, and to ensure that my expectations and targets are exceeded.

I discovered my interest in Public Speaking in school, and since then, I’ve always wanted to continuously experience the feeling I had on stage. Needless to say, it became my passion. As a result, I hosted several events and participated in numerous programs such as LAU MUN where Public Speaking is crucial.

I always enjoy meeting new people and building new relationships so feel free to connect or reach out to me with job opportunities.

jobs.jobTitle: Project Management and Site Engineer Intern
jobs.description:
Site Engineering:
- Site visits to 12 different projects located in Dubai. Accompanied by the Project Managers and Site Engineers, we were exposed to each site's procedure of works, special conditions, and challenges gaining practical knowledge in the Construction Industry. 

-Six Technical trips: Concrete batch plant (RMB), Pre-cast Concrete Factory (UPC), E - Construct, ERGA Group, Albonian International subcontractor, and GTC Laboratory.   

- Several workshops and lectures on topics such as Construction Drawings, Sustainable Construction, safety, Mechanical - Air conditioning & Ventilation - drainage works, MEP coordination with Architect and structural engineer, IT Infrastructure, and finishing. 

Project Management: 
- In parallel to the hands-on experience, lectures on significant topics provided us with a wealth of practical information, and exposure to the real world of construction and engineering. 

- Topics included: Planning & Scheduling, Cost Estimation & Pricing, Financials & Accounting in contracting/construction industry, Commercial Management of the construction process, BOQ & S-curve, Construction Insurance, project acceleration, & Delays, Disputes, and Arbitration. 

- Submitted a research paper on Advances in and the application of IT in the construction industry over the next decade and presented in front of DCC CEO and staff. 

- Arbitration Case study: the dispute between Contractor and Sub-contractor where 2 teams worked for a week on gathering relevant information, evidence, and assertions to prove the liability of the other party and try to win the case, where the arbitrator was the DCC's contract director.
  
      
          …
        
          see more

Product Promotion Project:
- Got introduced to the pharmaceutical industry with a deep analysis of factors that affect the industry.
- Received intense training on digital marketing concepts and strategies.
- Applied the learned concepts along with creative strategies to formulate a collective proposal on how to promote the product.

- Students from all universities where invited to solve challenging Business cases for EY, CISCO, and MSD.

general.headline: Actuarial Analyst at Actuscope Consulting SA
general.mutualConnectionsText: You and Rachelle Stephanie both know Jo Nammour SHRM-CP
general.description:
Responsible for a number of key Motor and Property & Casualty projects in KSA, UAE, Bahrain, Kuwait, Qatar, Jordan and Lebanon, namely:

•	Quarterly and Yearly Reserving Analyses for Motor and P&C lines of business:
	- Data processing and analysis
	- Estimating the IBNR reserves using different methods such as Chain Ladder, Bornhuetter-Ferguson, Average cost per claim, Expected Loss Ratio, etc.
	- Calculating the Unearned Premium reserve (UPR) and Premium Deficiency Reserve (PDR)
	- Estimating the Unallocated Loss Adjustment Expense Reserve
	- Reviewing the reinsurance treaties purchased by the Company and calculating any reinsurance accrual reserve, if needed
	- Writing the actuarial report and communicating the results to the Company

•	Yearly Financial Condition Reports (FCRs):
	- Reviewing the company’s income statement, balance sheet and some of its KPIs 
	- Evaluating its solvency position
	- Assessing the performance of the Company by line of business 
	- Analyzing its investment returns
	- Performing an expense analysis
	- Reviewing the reinsurance treaties and checking for potential credit risk or finite reinsurance
	- Checking for possible mismatch between the assets and liabilities
	- Reviewing the pricing adequacy of each line of business

•	Motor Pricing Analyses:
	- Data processing and organizing the rating structure
	- Calculating the burning costs and office rates
	- Assessing severity and frequency inflation 
	- Deductible pricing 

•	Motor Performance Monitoring:
Providing insurance companies with further insight to their better/worse performing Motor classes/fleets and thus enhancing their internal decision making mechanism in order to grow profitable books of business.

•	Business Planning Analyses:
	- Identifying the purpose of the business plan analysis
	- Gathering the required inputs from the distinct departments of the Company
	- Projecting the different variables within the income statement (premium, claims, expenses, commissions, etc) 
	- Forecasting the various assets and liabilities of the company
	- Calculating the company’s solvency ratio for the forecasted period

•	Designing and Developing excel-based templates for more efficient reporting

jobs.description: Pursuing Associate designation of the Casualty Actuarial Society (CAS)

projects.title: The Overhead HV transmission Lines in Al Mansorieh
projects.description:
Project description
    Proposed a simple and quick plan with the appropriate solution to finalize the transmission line project in Al Mansorieh within the scientific and objective framework taking into account the priority of health, environmental and social aspects of the residents.Technical Control and Auditing Office is to be assigned as a Neutral Third Party Arbitrator to make an objective (Technical Evaluation)  and the supervision of the works regarding the fulfillment of the project with the terms of the laws of public safety regulations and taking his recommendations to achieve these conditions fully for the purpose of implementing a safe high-tension transmission lines project in Mansourieh laws

projects.title: Decenetrelized generation in Lebanon
projects.description:
Project description
    The Decenterlized Generation (DG) in Lebanon comprises a set of Distributed Generating (DG) Plants whose total rating is 600-700MW situated in the various zones of the Country. The implementation of this plan shall start at the earliest stage of the 3000MW Generation Plan planned by the World Word Bank Projectr for the Eectricity Sector in Lebanon during the coming few years. The foreseen generating capacity of the (DG) project  and the 400MW of the Energy Trading Plan between the Private Generating Plants and EDL Grid forms a total sum of 1000MW. This will result cancellation of the existing pOWER Rationing Schedules within one year interval

projects.title: Energy Trading by the Public and Private Sectors
projects.description:
Project description
    Lebanese Patent certificate No. 5956 for the Energy Trading between the Private and Public Sectors in Lebanon.-Private Generations plants: Lebanon owns a great number of Private Generations plants that are not utilized efficiently. Private Plants rated 1MW and above could be paralleled with the Utility (EDL) to provide an extra capacity to the Network by almost 400MW.•	Paralleled 400MW Plant: The provided additional capacity to EDL network is at insignificant cost. This plant has a major advantage over the conventional plants that it could be operational much earlier than the conventional plants that takes quite long time as such.•	Energy Trading: The major part of the generated energy of the 400MW paralleled plant (around 67%) will be traded with EDL to reduce the rationing hours significantly. This process shall be implemented under strict environmental regulations.

givenRecommandations.text:
Through my working experience in the Consulting Engineering field, I have known Mr. Marwan Daya for approximately seven years ago as the General Manager of BTC-Lebanon, the Communication and Security Solution Provider and Systems Supplier.

When we me first, with his permanent and bright smile he introduced himself as the Co-Technical Partner for Project Engineers and Consultants by supporting them with the latest and most up-to-date technology in his field. He spent a great deal of time with me and my staff explaining the ways in which his group could serve our Clients efficiently and reliably. 

We executed our first project together in 2007 that involved providing a robust and reliable Telecom Network for one of our prestigious project in Beirut. During that time, after 2006 War in Lebanon, Mr. Daya has done a respectful and remarkable initiative when his company donated several turn-key telephone systems for some of the concerned Humanitarian institutions in Lebanon like Hariri Foundation and the Lebanese Red Cross.

Marwan is a committed and creative business professional, and I recommend him highly indeed for what he is doing in the field of telecommunication commerce and industry .
